intro: Aster ulmifolius, commonly known as the elm-leaf aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, heart-shaped to ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually blue to purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Aster ulmifolius thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks.
